column4: hey, im trying to run tasksel but I get a wierd error about debconf failing to run
It would help if you told us the specific error
just waiting for someone to let me know they are here... http://www.pastebin.ca/600916
http://lists.debian.org/debian-boot/2005/12/msg01190.html
Essentially, it's a problem with debconf that's supposed to be getting fixed in a new version
yes, i read that before, but i still can't solve the issue
Correct, you can't
so how do I run tasksel ?
According to that bug report, it's broken until the next version comes out. You can try to update it, but as I barely know what it is I wouldn't know if it's fixed yet
so my only fix is reinstalling the system ?
No...
I'm all ears... erm, eyes...
The fix is in debconf itself. Unless the new system has the updated version of debconf, that won't do anything
What I'm saying is, until you can update your version of debconf, you're screwed
so what I said, a total reinstall, is the only fix.
Yes, sure, reinstall your system so that it can have the same version of the app that has the problem, and you'll have a new system to configure and the same problem
Alternatively, wait until the new version of debconf comes out and update debconf.
tasksel crashed, and ever since then this is happening
Look, I'm just telling you what was in the bug report, and unless you can update your version of debconf, you won't be able to fix this
what I mean is that my system cashed today while using debconf, and now a lot of things are crashing and im thinking it had something to do with that
Sorry, but I can't diagnose your system, I'm only relating what the bug report said.
